Quotes: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live by the light that I have. I must stand with anybody that stands right, and stand with him while he is right, and part with him when he goes wrong.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: We call first truths those we discover after all the others.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: The hardest thing to understand in the world is the income tax.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Of all the sexual aberrations, chastity is the strangest.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: It is a grand mistake to think of being great without goodness and I pronounce it as certain that there was never a truly great man that was not at the same time truly virtuous.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The age of chivalry is past. Bores have succeeded to dragons.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Electric communication will never be a substitute for the face of someone who with their soul encourages another person to be brave and true.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: I never admire another's fortune so much that I became dissatisfied with my own.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Truths begin by a conflict with the police - and end by calling them in.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Switzerland is a small, steep country, much more up and down than sideways, and is all stuck over with large brown hotels built on the cuckoo clock style of architecture.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: For a war to be just three conditions are necessary - public authority, just cause, right motive.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: I know now that there is no one thing that is true - it is all true.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: What is truth? said jesting Pilate;and would not stay for an answer.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Science is but an image of the truth.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Faith: not wanting to know what is true.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: 'Evil men have no songs.' How is it that the Russians have songs?
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: When a man wants to murder a tiger he calls it sport;when a tiger wants to murder him he calls it ferocity.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Who are you going to believe, me or your own eyes?
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: I was like a boy playing on the sea-shore, and diverting myself now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell than ordinary, whilst the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: To myself I am only a child playing on the beach, while vast oceans of truth lie undiscovered before me.
Author: Isaac Newton

Quotes: What a good thing Adam had. When he said a good thing he knew nobody had said it before.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Denial ain't just a river in Egypt.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Light does not come from light, but from darkness.
Author: Mircea Eliade

Quotes: One should always play fairly when one has the winning cards.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Conversation about the weather is the last refuge of the unimaginative.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: That which has always been accepted by everyone, everywhere, is almost certain to be false.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: A war between Europeans is a civil war.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: It is the end. But of what? The end of France? No. The end of kings? Yes.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Nothing has really happened until it has been recorded.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: To thine own self be true, and it must follow, as the night the day, thou canst not then be false to any man.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
Author: Winston Churchill
